result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Meinburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due - applies to all monies due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription; defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; defendant shall submit to random blood, breath, and urine screens to determine compliance.
Court grants expunction upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment.  Defendant shall supply a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

timeConds.notes: commencing forthwith with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Meinburg

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Def appears in custody & w/Atty  Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial. Reading waived of Information.   Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 & orders Ct. 2 dismissed & read-in. State agrees not to charge possession of controlled substances arising from the same incident. Statements by Atty. Bensen. Statements by Atty. Romanowich. Atty. Romanowich moves for expungement. Atty. Bensen opposes expungement. Statements by defendant. Court grants defendant's request for expungement. Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Maintain absolute sobriety; No possess of controlled substance without valid prescription

s3:41 Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich for State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD will appoint counsel;  Defendant periodically stays in West Bend w/ his brother for work purposes; State requests cash bond; Argument from State; Court sets $1000 cash bond;   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. e3:52  Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
